glosses: Used for combining elements of similar function or equivalence, or choosing between multiple things; whether ... or, either … or, both … and, as well as.

examples.text: ...gerek ölçüsüz yapılan iskânlar ve gerek memleket dahilinde olan göçler...
examples.translation: ...both the extravagant settlements and the immigrations within the nation...

examples.text: Gerek bu maddeyi, gerek Kültür bakanlığına aid maddeleri diğer arkadaşlarla ... sabaha kadar müzakere ettik.
examples.translation: We discussed this article as well as the articles related to the Culture ministry with the other colleagues till morning.

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish گرك (gerek), from Old Anatolian Turkish كرك (gäräk), from Proto-Turkic *kẹrgek (“necessity, necessary”), from *kẹrge- (“to need”) + *-k (participle suffix).
